did.physdesc: Extent is approxmimate
did.abstract: This collection includes documents relating to the organization and administration of Harvard's Graduate School of Design, mainly between 1936 and 1993.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The material in this collection was assembled throughout the years in Robinson Hall, and later in Gund Hall.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions on Use and Access
accessrestrict.p: Contact the Special Collections Department, Frances Loeb Library, Graduate School of Design, Harvard University. Some folders may be restricted for a diversity of reasons, including internal Harvard University policies. Written request and permission from the librarian and/or dean may be required.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The first academic degree programs in architecture and landscape architecture at Harvard emerged from design education initiatives that began in 1874 when Charles Eliot Norton introduced architectural history into his fine arts courses. The first Harvard course devoted exclusively to architecture was offered by Herbert Langford Warren in 1893. In 1899 the first Harvard building devoted solely to instruction in the fields of design was started in memory of Nelson Robinson, Jr., a former Harvard student who had been interested in architectural design and landscape architecture. The Faculty of Architecture was established in 1914 to coordinate the curricula and degrees in architecture and landscape architecture. City planning became the third component of the design curriculum in 1909, when James Sturgis Pray began teaching planning courses within the landscape architecture program. It was not until 1936 that Harvard created a separate professional school for these various disciplines when the Graduate School of Design was established for the study of architecture, landscape architecture, and city planning. Joseph Hudnut was appointed dean of the newly established GSD, and he invited Walter Gropius to come to Harvard as chairman of the department of architecture in 1936. Another landmark during this period was the admission of women to the GSD for the first time in 1942. The postwar era brought enormous changes for all three professions. Both Hudnut and Gropius reached retirement age in the early 1950s, and Josep Lluis Sert was appointed dean in 1953. Among his many contributions was the establishment in 1960 of the first degree program in urban design in the United States.

scopecontent.p: This collection documents aspects relating to the organization and administration of the school. Materials include official registers, directories, news and press releases, and materials related to publications, exhibitions, conferences, lectures, and special events. It also includes some alumni association materials, library and building facilities, and GSD life photographs. The vast majority of the materials span the years 1936-1993.

arrangement.p: The collection GSD History Collection: Administrative Affairs is arranged into six series: Series A (Administration); Series B (External Relations); Series C (Publications and Exhibitions); Series D (Events); Series E (Library and Building Facilities); Series F (GSD Life: Memorabilia and Photographs).
Series A (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: Administration) is comprised of Subseries AA: General Administration; Subseries AB: Official Registers and Registrar's Office Materials.

Series B (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: External Relations) is comprised of Subseries BA: News and Announcements; Subseries BB: Development; Subseries BC: Alumni Relations; and Subseries BD: Student Forum.

Series C (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: Publications and Exhibitions) is comprised of Subseries CA: GSD Publications; Subseries CB: GSD Publications -- Miscellaneous Materials; Subseries CC: GSD Exhibitions: Brochures, Posters, Exhibition Committees.

Series D (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: Events) is comprised of Subseries DA: Gund Hall Opening and Related Materials; Subseries DB: Special Events (Demonstrations, Celebrations, Anniversaries); Subseries DC: Conferences and Lectures).
Series E (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: Library and Building Facilities) is comprised of Subseries EA: Library; and Subseries EB: Building Facilities.
Series F (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: GSD Life, Miscellaneous and Photographs) is comprised of Subseries FA: Miscellaneous; and Subseries FB: Photographs.

did.unittitle: Subseries AB: Official Registers and Registrar's Office Materials
did.physdesc: / Quantity: 30 folders / Dimensions: 1.5 linear ft. / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Subseries AB: Official Registers and Registrar's Office Materials is comprised of 30 folders (GSD History - Administrative. Boxes 1B and 2) and contains papers related to reports on grading systems, financial aid policies, student directories, student handbooks, student facebooks, and set of "Official Registers" since the 1950s through 2000.

Note: It should be noted that, in relation to "official" student groups within the GSD (and preceding School of Architecture and School of Landscape Architecture) there are several student publications included in the Rare Book Room (e.g. Connections, Synthesis, T-Square, Shelter, Task, among others that also document the history of the school. GSD Student Council Papers, 1966-1967 (Rare Ref H261m) are also included in the Rare Book Room together with the GSD Official Registers and GSD Alumni Directories.

did.unittitle: Series B: Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: External Relations

note.p: Note: Series B (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: External Relations) is comprised of Subseries BA: News and Announcements; Subseries BB: Development; Subseries BC: Alumni Relations; and Subseries BD: Student Forum.

separatedmaterial.p: Location of associated materials: See also in Rare Book Room: Rare Ref H261m "GSD Student Council Papers, 1966-1967" (papers include a set of 1963-1964 records as well).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 24 folders / Dimensions: 0.5 linear ft. / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Subseries BA: News and Announcements is comprised of 24 folders (GSD History - Administrative. Box 3) and contains papers related to press releases of faculty appointments, fellowships and events, such as lecture series. Many folders contain items (copies of clippings sent as summaries of weekly/monthly reports of public relations firm hired by the school ca. 1998-2001 for media outreach.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 21 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript; xerographic copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Press releases on faculty appointments, fellowhips, and events, such as lecture series. Included is an announcement from MIT about Waclaw Zalewski's appointment at MIT, announcement for the 10th annual Urban Design Conference ("Education and the Environment: the Design of Education for Design."), the Gropius Lecture by Sir John Leslie Martin, the symposium on "Architectural Criticism: Success or Failure?" organized by the magazine Connection, the Memorial Public Lecture Series in memory of Catherine Bauer Wurster, and an exhibition of photographs by Edward Miller.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 17 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript; print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Miscellaneous clippings, correspondence and newsletters related to urban design conferences and city matters.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 17 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: In July of 1965 the US Steel Corporation and the Harvard Graduate School of Design agreed to collaborate on a program designed to innovate new techniques in the education of architects in relation to structures, the nature of materials, and the use of mechanical equipment in buildings, thus the "Architectural Technology Workshop" was initiated. Includes typescripts and draft reports.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 43 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: List entitled "Art Wagon Volunteers" with contact information (addresses and phone numbers).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 14 items / Dimensions: varies / Medium: newsprint / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Miscellaneous clippings related to the GSD and its programs, faculty, and students: "Students Weather Review of Design Projects", "Rethinking Architecture: GSD Spotlights European Innovators", "The New Man at Harvard's Gund Hall", "City Planning Will Lose Recognition", "Professors Attack City Planning Department", "Bok Appoints B-School, GSD Deans", "From Gund Hall to Timbuktu?", "The Planning Department May Retain Accreditation", "McArthur and McCue Appointed Deans of the Business and Design Schools", "Cobb will Chair Architecture Department", "Carl F. Steinitz Given Tenure at the School of Design", and "Gund Hall: Up in 30 Minutes." Diverse sources Harvard Gazette, The Harvard Crimson, Boston Globe. Also includes a press release about President Derek C. Bok recommending the consideration of changes among the faculties of government and design to realign Harvard's programs in public policy, planning, and design.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 29 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript; copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: File includes two lists of media coverage, one with clippings and articles included in folders BA007 through BA014. Another entitled "Coverage Highlights - Harvard Design School 1998-2001" prepared by Resnicow-Schroeder (some of these included in folders through this folder and BA024). Items sent from Pat Roberts to Mary Daniels.

Note: Includes "Whither the New Urbanism?" (Providence Journal) on issues explored at Alex Krieger's Chairman's day Colloquium, "Urban Leaders Cover the Waterfront in Cities at Harvard" (Architectural Record), "Harvard's Landscape Architecture Program Turns 100" (Boston Globe, "At Harvard, a Spotlight on the Romanesque" (New York Times) on exhibition "Before and After the End of Time: Architecture and the Year 1000", and press release from the Associated Press "Planners Debate What to Put on Top of Big Dig."

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 22 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles, and report from RSA (Resnicow Schroeder Associates) relative media outreach for the exhibition and conference held at the GSD entitled Territories: European Landscape Design, article "Weird Science in a New Age Industry" (Architectural Record), and DRCLAS News on Jauregui's work in Rio de Janeiro's favelas that earned him the Veronika Rudge Green Award in Urban Design from the GSD.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 19 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings: "Harvard's Experiment on Mt. Auburn Street" (on projected -never built- buildings by Hans Hollein for Harvard), "Making her Landscape Pop" (The New York Times) about the landscape architecture of Martha Schwartz, "Koolhaas: aux Nouveau Visages de la Ville" (Air France Flight Magazine). And a couple of articles where Jerold Kayden is mentioned.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 38 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles, and report from RSA relative media outreach for the Veronika Rudge Green Award in Urban Design award, and the exhibition and conference held at the GSD entitled Territories: European Landscape Design. There is also media coverage of a discussion on architectural discourse by Michael Hays, Brendan Moran, Liane Lefaivre, and Jeffrey Kipnis; and discussions related to the Bunker Hill Bridge and the Big Dig, with participation by Richard Sommer. Also includes an article on a GSD distance-learning student experience.

Note: Articles include: "She's in a class by herself: Hawaii provides tropical backdrop for distance-learning GSD student"; "The Brothers Rashid: Hani, the Theorist; Karim, the Pragmatist"; "Shop Till You Drop: Excerpts from the Harvard Design School Guide to Shopping"; "GSD Prize awarded for Transforming Rio Slums"; and "Revival of the Fittest", among others.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 15 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles, and report from RSA relative media outreach relating to 100 Years of Landscape Architecture at Harvard conference and exhibition.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 17 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: color copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: "The Power List", published by Architecture, May 2000. Includes Ed Feiner ("The Federal Presence"); Rem Koolhaas ("The Philosopher King"), David Rockwell ("The Crowd Pleaser"), Jorge Silvetti ("Big Man on Campus"), Paige Rense ("The Shelter Queen"), Johnson and Sons ("The New Yorkers"), Phyllis Lambert ("The Patron Saint"), Art Gensler ("The Boss"), Frank Gehry ("The Master"), and Andres Duany ("The Evangelist").

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 26 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach relating to Harvard Design School initiatives. Also included is The New York Times obituary for Hideo Sasaki.

Note: Articles include: "Harvard Real Estate Symposium Hails Local Land-Use Planning", "Harvard Students Devise Villa Scheme", "Starts & Stops: Planning Debate Over Use of Surface Artery Space Pick Up Speed", "Session Produces Flood of Pittsburgh River Ideas", "Planners Debate What to Put on Top of Big Dig", "Center to Focus on Urban Revitalization", among others.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 28 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about Big Dig. Also includes articles from Wallpaper ("Mass. Education") featuring the GSD and MIT, an article from Vanity Fair ("Unbridled Taschen") on the publisher Benedikt Taschen and his books, and another article about an interactive teleconference between the GSD and Cornell's Department of Architecture.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 55 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies, color copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about The Design Arts Initiative Excellence in Design Award: in this case, Rei Kawakubo's work with an exhibition at the GSD: Comme des Garcons: Structure + Expression.

Note: Includes several nota bene and the following articles: "Kawakubo's Creations Cut from Fashion's Edge", (The Boston Globe), "Rei, the Revolutionary: Harvard Honours Rei Kawakubo with Design Award" (The Globe and Mail), "Unfashionable Design" (Architecture), "Rei of Light" (Interior Design), "Rei Kawakubo to be Honored" (Dallas Morning News), "The Art World Tries on Fashion, and Finds That It Fits" (The New York Times), "Style: Comme Again" (The Guardian).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 18 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: "Gender Studies Chair at Education School Held by Gilligan" (Harvard University Gazzette). Also includes news note on Philippe Starck receiving the Harvard Excellence in Design Award.
Note: File also includes information on the former Binladin Fund for Scholarships and Fellowships.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 45 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about Harvard Excellence in Design Award presented to Robert Wilson, and the accompanying exhibition at the GSD: Theatre of Drawing: Early Artworks of Robert Wilson; the Green Prize awarded to Sir Norman Foster; and the conferences Waterfronts in Post-Industrial Cities, and Modernism, Interdisciplinarity, and Landscape 1950-1970: The Sasaki Years at Harvard.

Note: Also includes references to the CCA's announcement by Herbert Muschamp of a new architecture and urban design competition. There are also some news notes related to the Loeb Fellowship; and about the Big Dig in Boston; Chairman's Day Colloquium (Alex Krieger).

Note: Included is the announcement of the endowment of a professorship in landscape architecture and urbanism in Islamic societies at the GSD by His Highness Prince Karim Aga Khan IV. Another article refers to Graham Gund's joint donation to the GSD and Harvard University Art Museum for exhibitions.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 26 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about Exploring (New) Urbanism and Thinking About Landscape conferences. There is also a copy of an article about Rem Koolhaas: "Dutch Architect Takes Starring Role" (The Wall Street Journal).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 20 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report (including one printed email exchange) from RSA relative media outreach about the Veronika Rudge Green Award in Urban Design. Includes as well article sent by Jerold Kayden to Pat Roberts about Thomas N. O'Brien, the director of the Boston Redevelopment Authority.
Note: The New York Times article "Architecture's Swiss Mystic" about Peter Zumthor (who later taught at GSD) is included.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 34 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report (as well as memorandum by Resnikow relative specific communications plan) from RSA relative media outreach about Modernism, Interdisciplinarity, and Landscape 1950-1970: The Sasaki Years at Harvard and 100 Years of Landscape Architecture at Harvard, exhibition and conference.Also includes article on Tyree Guyton who's installation coincided with the landscape anniversary celebrations.

Note: Also includes information relative the Water Sensitive Ecological Planning and Design symposium; announcement of bequest from the estate of Peter Louis Hornbeck to establish a professorship in landscape architecture at the GSD; and transcript of an interview by CNN with Jeffrey Huang.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 18 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies; clippings / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Copies of media coverage for Large Parks exhibition; Immaterial/Ultramaterial: Architecture, Design and Material book edited by Toshiko Mori; Harvard Design School Guide to Shopping a product of "Project on the City" (a seminar led by Rem Koolhaas yearly since 1996).
Note: There is also news coverage of Toshiko Mori's appointment as Chair of the Department of Architecture at GSD.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 35 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies; clippings / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about the exhibition AUTOeMOTIVE: The Design Work of J Mays (he received the Excellence in Design Award for 2002);. There is also press coverage of Harvard hosting Mario Coyula-Cowley, Cuban architect, as professor at Harvard; and on Rem Koolhaas' Prada store in Manhattan, New York.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 30 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies; clippings / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about the exhibition AUTOeMOTIVE: The Design Work of J Mays, Windshield: Richard Neutra's House for the John Nicholas Brown Family. There is also an article from Architecture about Office dA, the design firm of Monica Ponce de Leon and Nader Tehrani.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 29 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about Harvard Graduate School of Design Guide to Shopping by Rem Koolhaas and his students; "Harvard as Seen in Its Buildings" an article about Douglass Shand-Tucci's publication Harvard University: An Architectural Tour; and the exhibition and conference Territories: European Landscape Design. There is also an article from Architectural Design: "Branding- Signs, Symbols or Something Else Charles Jencks in Conversation with Rem Koolhaas."

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 58 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies; color copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Clippings, articles and report from RSA relative media outreach about The Joint Center for Housing Studies annual report State of the Nation's Housing Report, and additional articles on the state of housing in the city of Cambridge and university finances (coinciding with Larry Summers becoming the 27th president of Harvard). Also includes articles relative several exhibitions and conferences at the GSD: Immaterial / Ultramaterial, Territories: Contemporary European Landscape Design. Includes news note of Herzog and de Meuron receiving the Pritzker Prize.

note.p: Note: Subseries BC: Alumni Relations is comprised of 68 folders (GSD History - Administrative. Box 4 through 7) and contains papers related to alumni relations, printed matter from the HGSD Alumni Association such as the HGSDA Newsletter and Alumni Directories. Also includes files related to alumni events.

Note: This series is supplemented by Alumni Directory publications held in the Rare Book Room together with the GSD Official Registers. The include the following: Alumni in Architecture of Harvard University. First Report, 1932 (Rare Ref H261i 1932); Alumni in Architecture of Harvard University. Bulletin, 1934 (Rare Ref H261 i 1934 c.2); Alumni Directory. 1966, Harvard Graduate School of Design (Rare Ref H261 j 1966); 1975 Alumni Directory. Harvard Graduate School of Design (Rare Ref H261 ad); Harvard Graduate School of Design Alumni/ae Directory Supplement, 1976; Harvard Graduate School of Design Alumni/ae Directory Supplement of the Classes of 1975, 1976 & 1977 (published February 1, 1978); and GSD 1980 Alumni Directory.

Note: Miscellaneous letters sent by and to the HGSDA : Memo on the abolishment of the HGSD Association's dues system in order to establish an Alumni Annual Giving Program; Course evaluations for courses taken in the Department of City and Regional Planning; Request for testimonial letters to give as a gift to Dean Sert upon his retirement; proposed names for HGSDA committees; and student placement lists.

Note: Also included is a letter from Sert about tuition increases and statistics on growth for the GSD (includes numbers on student body, faculty, annual budget, annual research budget, annual library budget, library acquisitions, number of library volumes, scholarships and aid grants.

note.p: Note: Includes printed matter from the Harvard Graduate School of Design Association for the year 1967. Includes press release of the announcement of the construction of a new building for the design school (John Andrews, from Toronto, selected as architect for what would become Gund Hall).

Note: Document Research at the Harvard Graduate School of Design list the following as topics of research being carried out at the school: New Towns; Community Design; Architectural Literature; A Morphological Analysis of Selected Historic Urban Spaces; Architecture of the Vienna School, ca. 1900; Low Cost Housing Study; Highway Aesthetics: Environmental Planning and Design; Study of Relationships Between Achieving High Levels of Economic Development Consistent with Wise Use of Continental Shelf Resources; An Analysis of Environmental Perception and Attitudes; A Study of Landscape Architecture, Education, and Practice; Three Approaches to Environmental Resource Analysis; Relationship of City Planning to Area-Wide Health Planning; Boston Region Interindustry Study; Use of Urban Space; Urban Field Service; Study of Landlord-Tenant Law and Relations; Housing Authorities Study; A Selected Bibliography of City and Regional Planning; and research carried under the following study centers: Architectural Technology; Laboratory for Computer Graphics.

Note: Also includes development program brochures: "The New Building", "Program in Advanced Environmental Studies", and "Development Program: The Seed of that Better Reality." Also included are student placements upon graduation.

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1969-1970." File includes several papers / documents: Elections of Departmental Representatives and a General Council of the Graduate School of Design, Graduate School of Design General Council and Departmental Representatives, Address to the General Forum of the Harvard Graduate School of Design by Maurice Kilbridge, and Student Information and Registration Bulletin for the Academic Year 1969-1970.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 20 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1972-1973." Includes materials related to the dedication of Gund Hall: HGSDA Dedication Review, Gund Hall Dedication. October 12-13, 1972 (program of events), and request for support for an acquisitions fund for the Frances Loeb Library (signed by Maurice Kilbridge and Caroline Shillaber). Also includes information on applications to the Wheelwright Fellowship, and the HGSD Work-Study Program. There is also a letter from Kilbridge to alumnae in relation to "a concerted effort by the GSD to increase the number of women on its faculty" (includes a questionnaire).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 10 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11"; 8-1/2" x 4"; 7" x 5" / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1972-1973." Includes brochures / prospectuses of the -at the time- recently built Gund Hall, Invitation from Harvard President Derek Bok for a dinner in honor of the Donors to George Gund Hall.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 35 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1970-1971." Announcements of alumni events, faculty appointments, Council elections, reprint of a writing on the Frances Loeb Library by Caroline Shillaber, and correspondence related to pledges to the GSD's capital campaign.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 46 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1970-1971." Includes information about the job placement assistance program at the GSD, a booklet entitled Harvard and Money: a Memorandum on Issues and Choices (November 1970), correspondence about fundraising pledges for the construction of Gund Hall (photograph of Gund Hall under construction included in the stationery, explanation of the Wheelwright Fellowship, among other announcements and communications with alumni/ae.

Note: Also includes correspondence to alumni/ae related to the decision of the Harvard Corporation that the "Master in Architecture henceforth be awarded as the first degree in architecture and that it be made available retroactively, on application, to B.Arch. graduates of the school" (as of May 4, 1970).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 23 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1973-1974." Includes correspondence with alumni with explanation of and application form for the Wheelwright Travelling Fellowship, letter from George Anselevicius upon being appointed Chairman of the Department of Architecture, and ballots for Council of the HGSDA.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 33 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1971-1972." Information about continuing education courses, intention of creating a work-study program, fundraising appeal for the library, back-to-school letter, explanation of the Wheelwright Travelling Fellowship, effort to improve the status of women in the school ("we want especially to attract more qualified women students and to increase the number of women on the faculty"), and press release relative grievances lodged against Maurice Kilbridge by Professors Isaacs, Nash, and Vigier (includes press release and statement by Kilbridge).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 28 items / Dimensions: 5-1/2" x 8-1/2" / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Development papers, originally labeled "Printed Matter, 1970-1971." Includes explanation of Wheelwright Travelling Fellowship, brochure and recommendation form for the Loeb Fellowship Program, questionnaire for and about HGSDA News, and ballots for HGSDA Council.
Note: Also includes Program of Proceedings for Gund Hall opening/dedication day (with drawing of Gund Hall in yellow, orange, and purple). The program is tied with yellow yarn.

note.p: Note: Subseries BD: Student Forum is comprised of 28 folders and 1 box of photographs (GSD History - Administrative. Box #7) and contains papers related mainly to Student Forum lecture series during 1977 and 1978. The Subseries also includes a box of photographs of miscellaneous student events: Halloween Party, Beaux-Arts Ball in 2001.

separatedmaterial.p: Location of associated materials: See also in Rare Book Room (green custom-made box with loose leaves): Rare Ref H261m "GSD Student Council Papers, 1966-1967" (papers actually include a set of 1963-1964 records as well).

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 1 item / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Winter 1978 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on National Urban Design Conference, Fumihiko Maki, Goody Studio, Loeb Fellow, Wheelwright Fellowship, Faculty and Class Notes.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 3 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Spring 1979 issue of HGSD News. Features an interview with Peter Walker, and notes on faculty design awards, Fisher obituary, energy-saving design, US Senator Tsongas, a Communications Course, and Faculty, Alumni and Class Notes.

Note: Summer 1979 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Soltan Retirement, Condominium Courses, HUD Work Study Program, Book on Student Work, Urban Design Studio, Cambridge's Landscape, Faculty and Class Notes.
Note: Fall 1979 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Kilbridge's Resignation, Staff Appointments, Loeb Library, Faculty Appointments, Faculty, Alumni and Class Notes.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 4 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Spring 1980 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Student Study on Condominiums, Community Assistance Program for New York Waterfront, Adele Santos presenting film "The Invisible City."

Note: Summer 1980 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Harry Cobb appointed Chairman of the Architecture Department, Philip Johnson Speaks at GSD, Joseph Zalewski's Death Mourned (who taught at the GSD for 22 years), Olmsted Lecture by Vincent Scully, German Werkbund Reviewed by Julius Posener, Carpenter Center Revisited and Denys Lasdun Visits GSD as Eliot Noyes Design Critic.

Note: Fall 1980 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Second International Conference on Urban Design, Interview with David Hadlin on the American Home, Students Learn to Teach and Alumni and Class Notes, City and Regional Planning Department Adapting to Consolidation with Kennedy School, John Hejduk Presents His "Masques", Krier Lectures on Urban Space, Grant to Preseve Collections (Loeb Library), and Koetter and Silvetti Participate in Paris Biennale, Nelson Chen wins Wheelwright Fellowship.

Note: Winter 1980 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on McCue's appointment as Dean and his favoring a GSD reorganization, Barnes Named Noyes Critic, Newton Receives ASLA Medal, and Gund Lecture Series.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 3 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Winter 1981 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Richard Meier Named Eliot Noyes Visiting Design Critic, Designing in Islamic Cultures, Gehry Studio, Faculty, Alumni and Class Notes, Sert Wins AIA Gold Medal, Christo Presents Scheme for Central Park, Colquhoun Lectures on Le Corbusier, McHarg Lectures on Creativity and Fitness in Design, Halloween Party (with photos).

Note: Spring 1981 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Students Complete First Phase of Jerusalem Studies, On Designing a Science Library for Swarthmore College, Students Study Boston Harbor and islands, Sidney Shurcliff.

Note: Summer 1981 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Gerhard Kallmann Appointed Emeritus Professor, Olmsted Lecture by Halprin, Ada Louise Huxtable and Blanche van Ginkel Appointed to Visiting Committee, Frank Knox Traveling Fellowship, Social Architecture, Arata Isosaki and the Japanese Vernacular Tradition, Students Study Impact of Subway Extension to North Cambridge and Somerville, Landscape Plans for Dayton Ohio, and Jessie Smith Noyes Foundation Fellowships.

Note: Fall 1981 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Search for Chairman of New Planning Program, Second Harvard Architecture Review. Wendy Evans Wins Top Architecture Prizes, Students Study Northern Jerusalem, Daniel Schodek Appointed Acting Director of the Laboratory for Computer Graphics and Spatial Analysis, First Alumni Reunion.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 5 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Winter 1982 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Richard Sennett's Lecture Series, Helmut Jahn's Vision of Synthesis, Harry Cobb's Report to Visiting Committee, Michael Graves' Lecture on "Boundaries", Forum on "Monumentality and the City", Faculty and Class Notes.

Note: Spring 1982 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Changes in First Year Curriculum for Architecture Students, First Semester Landscape Architecture Studio, Jerusalem Studios, Ackerman's Palladio Lectures, Charles Moore's "Two Agendas", Laurence Booth's Studio, Response to Moshe Safdie's Criticism of Post Modernism.

Note: Summer 1982 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Laurie Olin being appointed Chairman of Landscape Architecture Department, Olmsted and Gropius Lectures, International Style Conference, News Notes, Faculty and Class Notes.
Note: September-October 1982 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Urban Design Theses Prize, James Templeton Kelly Prize, News Notes, Faculty and Class Notes

Note: November-December 1982 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Alumni Meeting to Discuss Legacy of Hudnut / Gropius Era, Paul Rudolph's Gropius Lecture, Exhibition The Gropius Era and Current Methods

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 5 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print; copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: January-February 1983 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Myron Goldsmith Appointed Noyes Visiting Professor of Architecture, Christopher Alexander Discusses "Deep Structures" in Architecture, Laurie Olin Shares View on Landscape Architecture, Alumni, Faculty and Class Notes.

Note: March-April 1983 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Harvard Architecture Review Competition, Loeb Fellowship Symposium, Monadnock Studio, Development Studio and Faculty Notes. Also includes note on Josep Lluis Sert's death in Barcelona, and Jaqueline Tyrwhitt's death in Athens.

Note: March-April 1983 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Gerald Hines' Gift to Support Instruction in Real Estate Issues, Notes on Maki, Bofill, and Frampton, Loeb Library Guft and Appointing of James Hodgson, Homage to Josep Lluis Sert, and The Eisenman/Alexander Debate.
Note: Copy of September-October 1983 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Gund Hall Renovations, Gropius Centennial Celebrated.

Note: November-December 1983 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Ohio State University's Arts Center Competition, Loeb Fellows, Sackler Muweum by Stirling, Symbolism in the Villa Lante, Faculty and Class Notes.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 5 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: January-February 1984 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on New Visiting Chair in Architecture and Urban Design Honoring Kenzo Tange, New Student Forum Established, Notes on Sir Geoffrey Jellicoe and Kevin Roche, Faculty and Class Notes.

Note: March-April 1984 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Northern Entry to Jerusalem, Walker Studio Focuses on Art and Landscape, Students Design Housing Complex for Site on Thames, Ralph Knowles Shares Research on New Energy-Efficient Architectural Forms, Aldo Rossi's Continuing Exploration of Typology and Morphology, Loeb Fellowship Lecture, Faculty and Class Notes.

Note: May-June 1984 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Shimizu Construction Co. Funds Construction Technology Lab, Eisenman Shares Discoveries Related to Work of Giuseppe Terragni, Gregotti Serves as First Tange Visiting Professor of Architecture and Urban Design, The Granite Garden by Anne Spirn. Also includes Kenneth Conant obituary.

Note: September-October 1984 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Faculty Reorganization, Forman Named Professor of Advanced Environmental Studies, Gomez-Ibanez Appointed Professor of Urban Planning and Public Policy, King Juan Carlos I and Queen Sophia of Spain Unveil Plaque Honoring Josep Lluis Sert, The Art of Public Place-Making.

Note: November-December 1984 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Robert Orchard Pledge to Create a Joint Professorship for Harvard College and the GSD, GSD Receives IBM and NEA Reserach Grants, Stilgoe Named Professor of Landscape History, GSD-ETH Exchange Program Established, The Quiet Benefactor: Robert C. Weinberg

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 5 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: January-February 1985 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Rafael Moneo's Appointment as Professor of Architecture and Chair of the Department, Eliot Noyes Lecture by Frank O. Gehry, Eames Memorial Lecture by Hans Hollein, Faculty and Class Notes.
Note: March-April 1985 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Boston Transportation Center, Boston Redevelopment Urban Design Studio, Other Studios, Fundraising for Student Financial Aid.

Note: May-June 1985 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Gropius Lecture by Henry Cobb, Kenzo Tange Lecture by Moneo, Boston's Enlightened and Practical Planners, Approvals Granted to Establish Two New Degree Programs (MDes and DDes), Laboratories Support Curriculum, Faculty and Class Notes.

Note: September-October 1985 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Rowe Appointed Professor of Architecture and Urban Design and Director of Urban Design, Doebele and Vigier Appointed to Named Professorships, Boston's Central Artery, GSD Opens Admission to Programs Leading to the Degrees Master in Design Studies and Doctor of Design.
Note: Fall 1985 issue of HGSD News. Features Capital Fund Drive Announced and Related Matters.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 3 items / Dimensions: 11" x 11" / Medium: print / Support: paper

note.p: Note: January-February 1986 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Laboratory for Construction Technology Opens its Doors, Burns to Join Faculty of Design as Professor of History of Architecture, Several Studios, Faculty and Class Notes.

Note: March-April 1986 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on Architectural Theses Projects, William J. Mitchell Joins the Faculty of Architecture, Lecture Series, Studios, and GSD to Celebrate It's 50th and Harvard's 350th Anniversaries.

Note: May-June 1986 issue of HGSD News. Features notes on GSD Explores Use of Computers in Design Education, International Conference on Education for Landscape Planning, Aga Khan Program at Harvard and MIT Broadens Its Effects, 25th Book Fund Established to Support Frances Loeb Library, Volume V of Harvard Architecture Review Explores "Precedent and Invention."

did.unittitle: Subseries CC: GSD Exhibitions -- Exhibition Files
did.physdesc: / Quantity: 35 items / Dimensions: 5" x 7" / Medium: photographs / Support: photographic paper

note.p: Note: Photographs of several buildings and projects. Most probably used in preparation of 1971 Gropius Exhibition.

Note: Included are Double School, Berlin, Germany, 1968; Impington Village College, Cambridge, England, 1936; Non-Ferrous Exhibition, Berlin, 1934; Soviet Palace (Theater) Moscow, 1931; Werkbund Exhibit, Berlin, 1930; Ukrainaian State Theater, Kharkov, 1930; Slab Apartment Block, Germany, 1928-1931; Total Theater Project, Berlin, 1927; Weissenhof Siedlung, Stuttgart, 1927; Torten Siedlung, Dessau, 1926; Gropiusstadt, Berlin; University of Baghdad, Berlin, 1957; Hansa Apartment Interbau, Berlin, 1956; Back Bay Center Project, Boston, 1953; Harvard Graduate Center, Cambridge, Massachusetts, 1949; US Embassy in Athens, Greece, 1961; Pan Am Building, New York City, 1963.

Many of the photographs of previous folders were used for this publication.

did.unittitle: Subseries CC: GSD Exhibitions -- Exhibition Files
did.physdesc: / Quantity: 24 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Several notes, internal memos and correspondence related to exhibitions at Robinson Hall. Most correspondence between members of the Exhibitions Committee, Jaqueline Tyrwhitt the Committee Chair.

Note: Includes list of materials on loan from the Peabody Museum for the exhibition Decoration and Form in Three Primitive Societies. There is also an outline for Gropius Birthday Exhibition, correspondence on exhibition The Shape of Our Cities, notes on Forms From Mathematics,

separatedmaterial.p: Location of associated materials: See also Walter Gropius and Architectural Education at Harvard.

did.unittitle: Subseries CC: GSD Exhibitions -- Exhibition Files
did.physdesc: / Quantity: items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Correspondence to and from Jaqueline Tyrwhitt, Dean Josep Lluis Sert and a series of institutions (including the University of Illinois and the Institute of Contemporary Art in Boston), in relation to a Le Corbusier Exhibition, a Fernand Leger Exhibition, and the exhibition entitled The Shape of Our Cities.

Note: The Shape of Our Cities was an exhibition grouped under ten headings, and was prepared as a basis for ten discussion sessions by groups of ordinary American citizens on the future shape of urban America. The exhibition was envisioned by Josep Lluis Sert and Jaqueline Tyrwhitt, Joseph Zalewski and Albert Szabo, all members of the Faculty of the Graduate School of Design, Harvard University, and was financed by the Fund for Adult Education.

note.p: Note: GSD Notebook on Han's Scharoun's Berlin Philharmonic Hall. Every year the GSD used to select a group of students to visit a work of architecture, either contemporary or "historical", in order to study and record it. The projects that resulted were displayed in an exhibition made by those students in conjunction with the Department of Lectures and Exhibitions. This notebook consists of some of those proposals.

did.unittitle: Series D: Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: Events

note.p: Note: Series D (Harvard University GSD, Administrative Affairs: Events) is comprised of Subseries DA: Gund Hall Opening and Related Materials; Subseries DB: Special Events (Demonstrations, Celebrations, Anniversaries); Subseries DC: Conferences and Lectures).

did.unittitle: Subseries DA: Events -- Gund Hall Opening and Related Materials
did.physdesc: / Quantity: 14 folders / Dimensions: 1/2 linear ft. / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Subseries DA: Gund Hall Opening is comprised of 14 folders (GSD History - Administrative. Box 12) and contains papers related to the design, construction, and opening of Gund Hall on 9 November 1969. Includes dedication addresses.

did.unittitle: Subseries DA: Events -- Gund Hall Opening and Related Materials
did.physdesc: / Quantity: 1 item / Dimensions: 11" x 9" / Medium: typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Bound volume Gund Hall Dedication Addresses with transcript of addresses delivered during the diverse dedication ceremonies: Gund Hall, Frances Loeb Library, Piper Auditorium, sculpture. Included among speakers: Graham Gund, President Derek Bok, William T. Piper, John Loeb, Mrs Frances Lehman Loeb, Mark Faverman, Josep Lluis Sert, Androgenscky, Kenneth Conant, Carolyn Shillaber, John Bolles, Jerry Gladstone, with Eduard Sekler and Bill Doebele directing the diverse dedications.

Note: Previously filed under Rare Ref H 261 k -- Dedication of Gund Hall. -Dedication of Piper Auditorium. -Dedication of Frances Lehman Loeb Library. -Le Corbusier Collection Dedication. -Dedication of Cluny Collection. -Dedication of a sculpture.

did.unittitle: Subseries DA: Events -- Gund Hall Opening and Related Materials

note.p: Note: Brochure George Gund Hall. Includes floor plans, lists architect (John Andrews) and contractors. Also includes brief history of buildings the school was housed in, and lists donors of Gund Hall, Frances Loeb Library, and Piper Auditorium.

did.unittitle: Subseries DA: Events -- Gund Hall Opening and Related Materials

note.p: Note: Files related to the capital campaign ( press releases, memorandums) for a new building for the GSD. Includes typescripts George Gund Hall: A New Building for the GSD and A Pledge to the Future: On Turning the Earth for George Gund Hall to House the Harvard Graduate School of Design. There are also files related to the groundbreaking ceremonies where a group of fifth-graders from the Houghton School, Cambridge turned the earth at the groundbreaking.

Also includes materials related to the capital campaign, and clippings from the Harvard Crimson about the tract of land on Quincy being acquired: "Harvard Pays $1 Million For Design School Tract" and "Design School Given $2 Million for Construction of New Center".

did.unittitle: Subseries DB: Events -- Special Events (Demonstrations, Celebrations, Anniversaries)
did.physdesc: / Quantity: 138 folders / Dimensions: 3 linear ft. / Medium: print; typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Subseries DB: Special Events (Demonstrations, Celebrations, Anniversaries) is comprised of 138 folders (GSD History - Administrative. Boxes 12, 13, 14) and contains 1 box of drawings by alumni on occassion of the 50th Anniversary of the GSD. Papers include materials of 1969 strike, Gropius' 80th Birthday, Urban Design Conferences, named conferences, lectires, Harvard's 350th Anniversary, GSD's 50th Anniversary.
Local Note: Some folders may be restricted for a diversity of reasons. Written request and permission from the librarian and/or dean required.

did.unittitle: Subseries DB: Events -- Special Events (Demonstrations, Celebrations, Anniversaries)
did.physdesc: / Quantity: 200 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescripts / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Papers related to the outcome of the 1969 Spring Strike: includes press releases relative the establishment of a GSD Forum, elections of departmental representatives and a general council of the GSD. Also includes study work group reports: Report from the Committee on Community Involvement; Report of Issues Study Group on Principles of Participation; Report on Educational & Research Policy, among others.
Note: See also GSD History Collection -- Academic Affairs.
Local Note: This folder is restricted. Written request and permission required, as indicated in DB000.

Note: File also includes card related to the exhibition Josep Lluis Sert: Architect to the Arts held at the Carpenter Center in 1978. Graphic design by Toshi Takayama. An exhibition of similar title Josep Lluis Sert: Architect to the Arts II was held at Carpenter Center in conjunction with Josep Lluis Sert: Archjitect of Urban Design held at Gund Hall, both in 2003.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 7 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: This folder contains typescript copies of six Gropius Lectures as follows: "The Development of the New Architecture" by Walter Gropius, April 14 1937 (although not the 1st Gropius Lecture, some have considered it the first Harvard Gropius Lecture); "The Expanding Frontiers of Architecture" by Josep Lluis Sert , 1962 (2nd Gropius Lecture); "Art and the Universities: Two Other Cultures" by Joseph Passonneau, 1963 (3rd Gropius Lecture) [two copies]; "Can We Teach Creativity" by Benjamin Thompson, 1964 (4th Gropius Lecture); "The Eternal See-Saw" by Jerzy Soltan, 1965 (5th Gropius Lecture); and Gropius Lecture by Thomas Hoving, 1967.

note.p: Note: Miscellaneous brochures, leaflets and cards for lectures and exhibitions. Includes text of 11th Annual Gropius Lecture by Barbara Ward (on occasion of the dedication of Gund Hall, and entitled An Urban Planet. Also included are brochures and/or cards for "Prudential Center Revisited", "Irvine by Design", "Olmsted the Man and the Artist", "Last Fifty Years of Italian Architecture Reflected in the Eyes of an Architect", "Democratic Theory and Urban Form", "Four Public Squares for Leonforte". Included as well are announcements for Gropius Lectures ("Constancy, Time and Architecture" and "Architecture Without Frontiers"), Dan Kiley Lectures, and Kenzo Tange Lecture.

note.p: Note: Subseries EA: Library is comprised of 153 folders (GSD History - Administrative. Boxes 16 through 19) and contains papers related to the library and its collections. Includes materials related to the library's history, former librarians and their research work.

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 13 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: typescript / Support: paper

note.p: Note: Correspondence and memos relating to construction issues once Gund Hall had opened. Included here are issues related only to the library portion of the building. From folder section labeled "Pending."

did.physdesc: / Quantity: 38 items / Dimensions: 8-1/2" x 11" / Medium: copies / Support: paper

note.p: Note: File includes floor plans of Gund Hall and particularly of Loeb Library within the building. From folder section labeled "Plans."

note.p: Note: File includes information sheets and statistical data relative history and growth of the library and its collections (Frances Loeb Library). From folder section entitled "Data."

note.p: Note: File includes Outline for a Building Program for the Library of the Graduate School of Design with library plan for the next 50 years (1967-2017), library requiremnents in view of a new building to be built for the GSD (Later Gund Hall), and transcript of a meeting where library needs were being discussed. Caroline Shillaber was head librarian at the time. From folder section entitled "Program."

note.p: Note: Statistics, outlines and graphs of library growth since 1934 through 1959. From "Library History" folder.

Note: Indicates the Library of Architecture was founded 1894, the Library of Landscape Architecture and City Planning was founded in 1911. They were both combined in 1956 to become the Library of the Graduate School of Design. By 1936 the library has 38,536 volumes; by 1956, 79,077 volumes; by 1966 126,741 volumes, and by 1972 150,000 volumes.
